summary: The document is a report from the Department of the Army detailing an interview with David Reed FROMER, a University of Wisconsin student, who refused to complete conscription-related forms. FROMER invoked his First and Fifth Amendment rights and mentioned his denied application for conscientious objection by the United States District Court. He refused to make any statements without his attorneys present.
key_findings: David Reed FROMER refused to complete conscription forms, citing his constitutional rights under the First and Fifth Amendments.
FROMER's application for conscientious objection was denied by the United States District Court.
He declined to provide any statements or participate in interviews without his attorneys being present.
The document highlights the Department of the Army's procedures and policies on conscription and personal security questionnaires during the 1960s.
